intro: Soldanella clusii var. cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical soldanella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. The variety is distinguished by its elongated, cylindrical flower buds, which distinguish it from other soldanella species.
